results.title: The Camel boy
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: In Australia’s early days the ship of the desert, the camel, was imported to help explore the harsh interior of this vast continent. Through the wonder of animation and live action ‘The Camel Boy’ takes you back to the beginning of this century for an exciting adventure story based on the actual journeys of explorers in Australia’s outback wilderness. The burning sands of the inland desert and the hurricane lashed waters of the ocean are the setting for this story of friendship between a boy and a camel.

results.title: The Caleche driver
results.creator_credit: Raymond Garceau, Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Much of the old-world charm of Quebec city can be accredited to the open, horse-drawn carriages in which visitors may explore the city - and to the drivers of these ancient vehicles. In this film we get to know Onesime Lamothe, veteran trooper of Quebec’s historic avenues and ever-ready fountain of knowledge.

results.title: Living Legacy : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Eight very different people tell of how Legacy came into their lives, the bonds they formed, the support of Legacy and how Legacy has remained with them throughout their lives.

results.title: The Camomile lawn
results.creator_credit: Peter Hall, Glenn Wilhide, Sophie Balhetchet, ABC-TV (Australia), Channel Four and ZED Ltd
results.brief_description: It is August 1939, and Helena and Richard Cuthbertson with their young niece, Sophy, are preparing for the annual visit to Cornwall, where they meet with Richard’s other nephews and nieces - Oliver, Calypso, Polly and Walter. Sophy is resented by her aunt and has little in common with her invalid uncle, who lost a leg in the trenches. The cousins plan to run the ‘terror run’ - a fearless night-time dash along the cliff path. Helena and Richard invite Max and Monika Erstweiler - Austrian refugees to the ritual dinner before the ‘terror run’. Max is a renowned classical violinist, and he and Monika believe their only son is now in a concentration camp. The night is brought abruptly to an end by news from Polly and Walter’s father that the hospital where he is a surgeon is about to be evacuated. War must be imminent… Based on the novel by Mary Wesley. Stars Felicity Kendal and Paul Eddington.

results.title: The Cable guy [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ben Stiller, Andrew Licht, Jeffrey A. Mueller, Judd Apatow and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: After being dumped by girlfriend Robin (Leslie Mann), Steven Kovacs (Matthew Broderick) moves house and into his life enters Cable Guy Chip Douglas (Jim Carrey); a dry, wise cracking tradesman with a speech impediment who is keen to pursue a relationship that goes beyond that of client and service provider. Their outings initially consist of a trip to the cable satellite but progresses to dinner dates and (stolen) gifts. After a frightening basketball game in which Chip replaces one of their players, Steven sees the dark undertones emerging in Chip and begins to fear the intensity of the friendship. When he starts interfering with his relationship to Robin (including beating up one of her dates in a bathroom), Steven wants out, but the entertainment and technology savvy Douglas is proving hard to shake. Jim Carrey throws himself into the role of the Cable Guy, at times hilarious, but always verging on malevolent; as a consequence, the black humour reflects the film’s ambivalent exploration of the genre and content matter, thus giving it a comedy/thriller tag. Director Stiller features in a sub plot played out on the television screen of a former child star accused of killing his twin. Cameos by: Andy Dick, Janeane Garafalo, Kathy Griffin, Eric Roberts, Owen Wilson.

results.title: The Cabinet of Dr Caligari [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Robert Wiene, Erich Pommer and Delca-Bioscop
results.brief_description: With psychosis, paranoia and the blurring of the distinction between madness and sanity at its centre, Caligari can be seen thematically as a distant forerunner to the psycho-horror sub genre. A sinister hypnotist, Dr. Caligari, exhibits his creature, a somnambulist named Cesare, at the town fair. When a series of bizarre murders follow, Dr. Caligari is accused of using the somnambulist to commit the murders. A silent masterpiece, “The Cabinet of Dr Caligari” features macabre theatrical-style set designs influenced by German Expressionism. The intention of the filmmakers was to expand the notion of cinema beyond its quest for re-creation of reality. These elaborate and haunting sets serve as a touchstone for the characters’ inner turmoil. This version features the original colourisation with green, brown and blue tints. Cast includes Werner Krauss, Conrad Veidt, Friedrich Feher, Lil Dagover, Rudolf Lettinger.

results.title: The Butterfly ball and the grasshopper's feast
results.creator_credit: Lee Mishkin, Jack King and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: This delightful Halas and Batchelor cartoon has a number of well-known rock stars singing an infectious song while the visuals enact the story of a frog and his friends who join together to attend the most spectacular ball of the year. Based on part of the book of verses and illustrations, “Butterfly Ball” by Alan Aldridge and William Plomer. Music by Roger Glover and animation by Harold Whitaker. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: The Business of strangers [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Patrick Stettner, Robert H Nathan, Susan A Stover, Headquarters and i5 Films
results.brief_description: Patrick Stettner’s debut feature, touted as the female anti-dote to “In the company of men” (Neil LaBute, 1997), examines the politics and frissons that arise between two women of different age and class, over the course of one eventful evening. Julie Styron (Stockard Channing) is an astute vice president who, having forfeited intimate relationships, has achieved great success in her career. Panicked by an unexpected call from her boss, she calls on head-hunter Nick Harris (Frederick Weller) fishing for clues. When Paula Murphy (Julia Stiles), a temp who is hired to assist Julie with an important presentation, shows up late, Julie vents her frustration by instantaneously firing her. Later that evening, feeling faintly repentant, Julie buys Paula a drink in the hotel bar, which leads to debauchery. Despite Julie’s reluctance, Nick joins them, forming an instant attraction to Paula, and from there the film takes a dramatic turn as Nick is drugged (by Paula) and the women conspire to exact revenge upon his prone body. Despite being linked by gender and the shared experience of operating within a patriarchy, money, knowledge and age divide these women, making them, at times, adversarial. The power plays between the two make for engrossing viewing; when Paula and Julie clash, they are operating from such different spectrums that they present a fascinating interplay of agendas and morality.

results.title: The Business of photography
results.creator_credit: K Lynch, Sally Lynch and Media West
results.brief_description: Whether you’re already a working pro or just beginning to think about a career in photography, this video is for you. You’ll meet the art directors and the editors who actually buy pictures and give out the profitable assignments. This video contains three half-hour episodes for easy viewing, the topics include preparing your portfolio, choosing your direction, formats, editing your work, selling your services, how the business works, breaking in, digging deeper, pricing and billing
